implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the REST endpoint '/tasks' for adding a new task. Receives task data and invokes the service layer to process and store the task.
implementation.name: create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to '/tasks' with task data:
    Try to create a new task using the service layer
    If successful, return the created task
    If an error occurs, raise an HTTP exception

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles business logic for creating a task. Logs the operation and delegates task creation to the repository layer.
implementation.name: TaskService.create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Log the creation attempt for the user
Call repository.add_task with the provided task data
Return the result from the repository

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the storage of the new task in an in-memory list. Assigns a unique ID, appends the task, and returns it.
implementation.name: TaskRepository.add_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Create a new Task object with a unique ID and provided data
Append the Task to the internal list
Increment the ID counter
Log the creation
Return the Task object
